jgame

Class GObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • jgame.GObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GObjectHolder, GPaintable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GButton, GContainer, GMessage, GSprite

    public class GObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements GPaintable, GObjectHolder
    A standard game object. All game objects should inherit from this class. This class provides basic functionality such as position (via the x and y variables), size (via the width and height) variables, rotation (via the rotation) variable, customizable anchor weights, a controller system, and a listener system.
    Author:
    William Chargin

    • Field Detail

      • x

        private double x
        The x-coordinate of this object with respect to its parent. This value may be negative, positive, or zero. By convention, low values of x are at the left of the screen, and high values of x are at the right.

      • y

        private double y
        The y-coordinate of this object with respect to its parent. This value may be negative, positive, or zero. By convention, low values of y are at the top of the screen, and high values of y are at the bottom.

      • width

        private double width
        The width of this object. This value may be positive or zero, but may not be negative.

      • height

        private double height
        The height of this object. This value may be positive or zero, but may not be negative.

      • rotation

        private double rotation
        The rotation of this object, in degrees, clockwise, with 0° facing due east.

    • Method Detail

      • antialias

        protected static void antialias(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Sets the specified graphics context to be antialiased. This will smooth out lines, curves, and text drawn with the graphics commands, but not images imported from files. To smooth images that have been rotated or scaled, use goodImageTransforms(Graphics2D).
        Parameters:
        g - the context to antialias

      • goodImageTransforms

        protected static void goodImageTransforms(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Maximizes the quality of image transforms (rotate, scale, skew, etc.) for the specified graphics context. This will smooth almost all jagged edges caused by transforming images but significantly increase render times. Only use this is you have tried goodImageTransforms(Graphics2D) and it does not provide good enough quality.
        Parameters:
        g - the context to antialias

      • angleTo

        public double angleTo(double x,
                      double y)
        Determines the angle from this object's anchor point to the point specified by the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the point for which to calculate the angle
        y - the y coordinate of the point for which to calculate the angle
        Returns:
        the angle, in degrees, clockwise, where 0° means due east, or 0 if the two points are coincident

      • angleTo

        public double angleTo(GObject other)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Determines the angle from this object's anchor point to the given object's anchor point.
        Parameters:
        other - the object for which to calculate the angle
        Returns:
        the angle, in degrees, clockwise, where 0° means due east, or 0 if the objects have the same anchor point
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if other is null

      • angleTo

        Determines the angle from this object's anchor point to the given point.
        Parameters:
        point - the point for which to calculate the angle
        Returns:
        the angle, in degrees, clockwise, where 0° means due east, or 0 if the two points are coincident
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if point is null

      • approach

        public void approach(double percentage,
                     GObject other)
        Moves this object a given percentage of the distance between itself and another object. This differs from moveToward(double, GObject) in that it accepts not a fixed distance in pixels but rather a percentage of the distance between the two objects. For example, passing 0.5 as percentage would cause this object to move to the midpoint of the line segment formed by the original anchor point of this object and that of the target object, while a percentage of 1.0 would perform the same function as moveTo(GObject). If the distance to the other object is zero, no action will be performed and no error will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        percentage - the percentage of the distance to move
        other - the object to move toward.

                         double y)

      • getAbsoluteToRelativeTransform

        public java.awt.geom.AffineTransform getAbsoluteToRelativeTransform()
        Creates an AffineTransform to transform points from the absolute coordinate space back to this coordinate space by traversing the parent hierarchy tree.

        The transform generated by this method is the inverse of the transform generated by getRelativeToAbsoluteTransform().

        Returns:
        a transform

      • getFirstAncestorOf

        public <T extends GObject> T getFirstAncestorOf(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Gets the first ancestor of the given type. The "first" ancestor is the ancestor that is the fewest levels above this object; for example, the parent would take precedence over the parent's parent.

        A subclass is also be considered a match: for example, if A extends GObject and B extends A, a call to getFirstAncestorOf(A.class) could also return any B.

        Parameters:
        clazz - the class to search for
        Returns:
        the first ancestor found, or null if none exists
        Since:
        1.2

        Gets the height of this object.

        public int getIntHeight()
        Returns the integer height of this object. The integer height is the ceiling value of the height property.
        Returns:
        the integer height

      • getIntWidth

        public int getIntWidth()
        Returns the integer width of this object. The integer width is the ceiling value of the width property.

        the integer width

      • getLastAncestorOf

        public <T extends GObject> T getLastAncestorOf(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Gets the last ancestor of the given type. The "last" ancestor is the ancestor that is the most levels above this object; for example, the parent's parent would take precedence over the parent.

        A subclass is also be considered a match: for example, if A extends GObject and B extends A, a call to getLastAncestorOf(A.class) could also return any B.

        Parameters:
        clazz - the class to search for
        Returns:
        the last ancestor found, or null if none exists
        Since:
        1.2

      • hitTest

        public boolean hitTest(GObject other)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Performs an imprecise (bounding-box) hit test on this object and the given object. For a more precise (contour) hit test, use preciseHitTest(GObject).
        Parameters:
        other - the object to perform the test on
        Returns:
        true if the objects intersect, or false if they do not
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if other is null

      • moveAtAngle

        public void moveAtAngle(double distance,
                        double angle)
        Moves this object a given distance at the given angle.
        Parameters:
        distance - the distance to move
        angle - the angle at which to move, in degrees, in parent coordinate space
        Since:
        1.2

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(GObject other)
        Moves this object to the given object. This is equivalent to calling other.snapAnchor(this).
        Parameters:
        other - the object to move to

      • moveToward

        public void moveToward(double distance,
                       GObject other)
        Moves this object a given distance in the direction of the given object. This may cause the object to pass the target object.

        This is equivalent to: 

         moveAtAngle(distance, angleTo(other));
        Parameters:
        distance - the distance to move
        other - the object to move toward

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Paints this object. The default GObject implementation does nothing but paint subcomponents.
        Specified by:
        paint in interface GPaintable
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics context on which to paint

      • paintSandboxed

        private void paintSandboxed(GPaintable object,
                            java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Prepares and paints the object in a sandboxed graphics environment.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to paint
        g - the graphics context to use as a basis for the sandbox

      • preciseHitTest

        public boolean preciseHitTest(GObject other)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Performs a precise (contour) hit test on this object and the given object.
        Parameters:
        other - the object to perform a hit test on
        Returns:
        true if the two objects intersect, or false if they do not
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if other is null

        Specified by:

      • removeSelf

        public boolean removeSelf()
        Attempts to remove this object from its parent. If this object's parent is null, then no action will be performed and no error will be thrown.
        Returns:
        true if the object was successfully removed, or false if it was not

      • setAlpha

        public void setAlpha(double alpha)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the object's alpha.
        Parameters:
        alpha - the new alpha
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the alpha is outside of the range [0.0, 1.0]

      • setAnchorCenter

        public void setAnchorCenter()
        Sets the anchor to the center. This is the default weight.

      • setAnchorPosition

        public boolean setAnchorPosition(double x,
                                 double y)
        Sets the anchor point position in pixels. This method simply calls setAnchorPositionX(double) and setAnchorPositionY(double).
        Parameters:
        x - the x anchor point position, measured from the left
        y - the right anchor point position, measured from the top
        Returns:
        true if both operations succeeded, or false if one or more failed

      • setAnchorPositionX

        public boolean setAnchorPositionX(double x)
        Sets the anchor position in pixels, where 0 is the left edge of the object and the result of getWidth() is the right edge. This calculates a percentage for the anchor weight based on the object's current width. If the width is 0, no action is taken, no error is thrown, and false is returned.

        As long as the width is non-zero, this method is the same as: 

         setAnchorWeightX(x / getWidth());
        Parameters:
        x - the anchor point position, measured from the left
        Returns:
        true if the width is non-zero and the anchor point has been set, or false if the operation failed

      • setAnchorPositionY

        public boolean setAnchorPositionY(double y)
        Sets the anchor position in pixels, where 0 is the top edge of the object and the result of getHeight() is the bottom edge. This calculates a percentage for the anchor weight based on the object's current height. If the height is 0, no action is taken, no error is thrown, and false is returned.

        As long as the height is non-zero, this method is the same as: 

         setAnchorWeightY(x / getHeight());
        Parameters:
        y - the anchor point position, measured from the top
        Returns:
        true if the height is non-zero and the anchor point has been set, or false if the operation failed

      • setAnchorTopLeft

        public void setAnchorTopLeft()
        Sets the anchor weight to (0.0, 0.0).

      • setAnchorWeight

        public void setAnchorWeight(double anchorWeightX,
                            double anchorWeightY)
        Sets the x and y anchor weights. This is a convenience method to combine setAnchorWeightX(double) and setAnchorWeightY(double).
        Parameters:
        anchorWeightX - the x anchor weight
        anchorWeightY - the y anchor weight

      • setAnchorWeightX

        public void setAnchorWeightX(double anchorWeightX)
        Sets the rotation weight along the x-axis, from 0.0 (full left) to 1.0 (full right).
        Parameters:
        anchorWeightX - the new rotation weight
        See Also:
        anchorWeightX

      • setAnchorWeightY

        public void setAnchorWeightY(double anchorWeightY)
        Sets the rotation weight along the y-axis, from 0.0 (full top) to 1.0 (full bottom).
        Parameters:
        anchorWeightY - the new rotation weight
        See Also:
        anchorWeightY

      • setBounds

        public void setBounds(double x,
                      double y,
                      double w,
                      double h)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets this argument's bounds to the given coordinates. This is equivalent to calling setSize(double, double) and setLocation(double, double), or calling setX(double), setY(double), setWidth(double), and setHeight(double).
        Parameters:
        x - the new x-coordinate
        y - the new y-coordinate
        w - the new width
        h - the new height
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the width or height is negative

      • setBounds

        public void setBounds(java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D r)
        Sets this argument's bounds to the given rectangle. This is equivalent to calling setBounds(double, double, double, double) with the rectangle's properties.
        Parameters:
        r - the new boundary rectangle

               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if height is negative

                        double y)

        y - the new y-coordinate

      • snapAnchor

        public void snapAnchor(GObject snap)
        Snaps the given object's anchor point to this object's anchor point in local coordinate space. This object will not be affected.
        Parameters:
        snap - the object to move

      • snapChild

        public void snapChild(GObject snap)
        Snaps the given child's anchor point to this object's anchor point in parent-child coordinate space. This object will not be affected.
        Parameters:
        snap - the child to move

      • snapChildToCenter

        public void snapChildToCenter(GObject snap)
        Snaps the given child's center point to this object's center in parent-child coordinate space. This object will not be affected.
        Parameters:
        snap - the child to move

      • startDrag

        public void startDrag()
        This method adds a MouseLocationController to the object; the object will be dragged by the mouse until stopDrag() is called.

      • stopDrag

        public void stopDrag()
        This method undoes a previous call to startDrag().

      • viewHidden

        public void viewHidden()
        Invoked when this view is hidden. By default, does nothing.

      • viewShown

        public void viewShown()
        Invoked when this view is shown. By default, does nothing.
